newsitem.title: EGYPT: Man killed by Egypt police not Islam militant head.
newsitem.headline: Man killed by Egypt police not Islam militant head.

text.p: The Egyptian authorities have found that a man killed by police last week was not the prominent Islamist militant leader they thought he was, security sources said on Monday.

A police officer shot and killed the suspected militant on Saturday on a train travelling from Luxor to Cairo after mistakenly recognising him as Mohamed Abdel Moneim el-Farshouti, wanted for several attacks.

The officer also killed another unidentified man and wounded a passenger in the shooting near Sohag, 400 km (250 miles) south of Cairo. Police are trying to identify the two dead men, the sources said.
Police have said Farshouti is a prominent leader of the Gama'a al-Islamiya (Islamic Group), the largest militant group fighting the Egyptian government.
More than 1,000 people have been killed and hundreds wounded since it launched an armed campaign in 1992.
